description:
The identity of the mysterious foe plaguing the Legion is revealed, but not before the battle takes its toll on Shrinking Violet...or does it? Plus, the Legion learns of an impending threat of galactic scaleâ€”one they can't hope to fight without some major mega-powered help.

The Legion defeat Starfinger, who is revealed to be a brainwashed Jan Arrah. The Legion then learns about the threat of the Sun-Eater, a being that destroys galaxies by eating suns. The Legion are informed that there are five criminals in the universe that have the power to help destroy the Sun-Eater and the Legion needs to gather them for assistance.
name: Fallen Star

description:
With the entire Legion out saving the galaxy, a new threat rises to attack the team at its most vulnerable pointâ€”their headquarters, staffed by "civilians" Chuck Taine, Tenzil Kem, Lori Morning and United Planets liaison officer Shvaughn Erin!

While the Legionnaires are off planet, the staff of the Legion headquarters, as well as Lori Morning, battle potential attackers and are able to rebuff them.
name: While You Were Out...

description:
Down to the last Legionnaire, the team is on the verge of total defeat at the hands of the Fatal Five! And the odds don't look much better when some mysterious reinforcements crash the party!

The Legionnaires deal with the Fatal Five and the Sun-Eater. Meanwhile, Ambassador Wazzo seems to have snapped after the death of her daughter Apparition and seems intent on destroying the Legion.
name: To The Rescue

description: Introducing the mighty Marvel characters you've never seen before in an epic twelve-part saga! Think that the fight between good and evil began with the debut of the Fantastic Four? Think there weren't costumed crime-fighters before Spider-Man? Think again! Get ready to meet a whole host of previously unknown heroes and villains! Who are these men and women of mystery? Who are Fireball, Flatiron, Cassandra, Oxbow, Liberty, Captain Hip & Sunshine, the Yankee Clipper, Effigy, Rumor and The Eternal Brain? Why have their exploits remained secret? And what about some of the faces you may recognize, such as Nick Fury, the Watcher, the Sub-Mariner and Doctor Strange? What is their part in this enigmatic adventure? And how will these strange characters reveal new details in our sprawling tapestry of time? The Marvel Universe has a secret... and it's time you learned it!
name: This Is Where It Ends!

description: Continuing the saga that sheds light on the untold past of the Marvel Universe! Three years before the cataclysmic events of our premiere issue, the man called Justice battles to fulfill the promise and legacy of the legendary Yankee Clipper! Meanwhile, an ages-old threat to the Earth is suddenly revealed! Plus: What is the truth behind Effigy and the top-secret super team known as the First Line?!
name: Fifth Column

description: Continuing the saga that blows the lid off of the Marvel Universe's secret past! Meet the powerful parents of Gadfly! Witness the brain-tingling origin of Walkabout! Spring into action with America's #1 fun-loving couple, Oxbow and Pixie! And join secret agent Nick Fury as he investigates Marvel's Lost Generation of super heroes!Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
name: Secrets: Great & Small

description: How does a mission to the Middle East leave the First Line shattered? What ingenious plan leads to Effigy's greatest success?and most tragic failure? And why does the Black Fox retire... again? The answers to these questions stand revealed in the story we just had to call "Holy War!"
name: Unholy War

description: From the heart of the city to the wilds of Transylvania, the Black Fox faces his greatest challenge! Plus: More about the bizarre past of the man called Nocturne! Plus: Doctor Strange!
name: The Tomb Of Diablo!

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: Highly Placed Sources

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: Crisis of Conscience

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: Wild in the Streets

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: Lightning in the Day

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: Mad to Live

description: The continuing adventures of that decades-spanning team of heroes... The Front Line!
name: After... and Before!

description: Where it all ends and where it all begins for First Line.

OverviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

By popular demand, the heroes for The '90s become the heroes for the new millennium!Â  Get in on the ground floor as Marvel's teens supreme make their much-anticipated comeback in their own ongoing series! The young crime-fighters who comprised the New Warriors went their separate ways in NOVA #1, but the bouncing bundle of energy known as Speedball is bound and determined to re-form the group, from scratch, if need be!Â  But as he revisits former teammates and potential new recruits, the all-powerful Blastaar is accidentally transported straight to the Genetech Research Facility!Â  Can Robbie Baldwin construct a new squad capable of defeating a foe who has gone toe-to-toe with the entire Fantastic Four? Â And if so, can he do it before the Negative Zone nasty lays waste to Long Island?!Â  Former teammates Justice and Firestar (now appearing every month in AVENGERS... but you knew that, right?) lend a hand as the newest incarnation of the New Warriors starts off with a blast!Â  You got a peek at the team in NEW WARRIORS #0 (which shipped in June with WizardÂ¹s Avengers Super Special), now you can be there as Nova, Speedball, Namorita, Turbo, Jolt and the all-new hero named Aegis come together for the very first time... and hopefully, Blastaar wonÂ¹t make it their last!Â  He breathed new life into GENERATION X, now writer Jay Faerber is joined by newcomer Steve Scott, whose clean yet kinetic art infuses the series with energy and optimism!
name: One Good Reason

description:
OverviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

The New Warriors tackle their old foes Genecide and Euginex! Their crusade: to restart human evolution by eliminating all the "unworthy" people saved by modern medicine?starting with the New Warriors' own Namorita! Featuring a cover by former NEW WARRIORS penciler (and current Transmetropolitan artist) Darick Robertson!
name: Artificial Lives

description:
OverviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

Is there a traitor within the new team?! The New Warriors find themselves trapped between two rival street gangs--who are armed to the teeth with hi-tech weaponry! And if that's not bad enough, there just may be a startling connection between these gangs and one of the Warriors' own!
name: Loyalties

description: OverviewThe New Warriors' Crashpad is destroyed, and all fingers point to... Aegis?! What is the new hero's link to the hyper-armed street gangs terrorizing New York? And how will the rest of the team react to having a traitor in their midst? Also, what's up with the budding romance between Namorita and the Human Torch? (Do fire and water mix?) Plus: the intro of Heavy Mettle!
name: Betrayal

description:
Overview

Guest-starring Generation X! The all-new threat of Biohazard ravages the New Warriors! Not to worry, Generation X has arrived to save the day! But what if our heroes don't want to be saved?! Jay Faerber unites the two teen teams he writes in one adventure! Cover by Darick Robertson.Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

Spoilers



New Warriors attack the Generation X, targeting Emma Frost, because they wanted revenge for what Emma did to former new warrior Firestar. At the end, Emma explains Firestar already forgave her, and both New Warriors and Generation X (including Emma Frost) make peace.
name: Responsibility

description:
OverviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

This issue features two big returns: Night Thrasher is back... and so is Nova's classic costume! It seems like everything's falling apart for our teen heroes! Turbo has a crush on Firestrike... who just so happens to be the assassin hired to kill her! Meanwhile, Bolt's battle with the Legacy Virus takes a turn for the worse! Plus: A mysterious presence is keeping tabs on Aegis! But who cares...because Nova's original costume is back! Cover by Darick Robertson.
name: Trust

description:
Overview

Turbo thinks she's found the love of her life. Too bad Mr. Right is actually an assassin hired to kill her! Â Sound bad? Just wait until you see what happens when she finds out!Â  Hearts will be broken, along with a couple of bones! cover by Darick Robertson.
name: Change Of Heart

description:
OverviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

Iron Fist and Night Thrasher guest-star as a new story arc begins! Groomed since birth to be the ultimate Hand assassin, 15-year-old Junzo Muto must pass one final test to assume leadership of the deadly ninja clan: steal the power of the Iron Fist!
name: Rite Of Passage

description:
Overview

A tie-in to IRON MAN #29! Beaten and bruised from their battle with the Hand, the New Warriors now find themselves up against the frozen terror known as Blizzard! Doesn't sound too tough for Marvel's premiere teen heroes, you say? Then how about trying to stop Iron Man from beating him to death, and then killing the Warriors themselves?!
name: No Good Deedâ€¦

description:
OveviewÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

By the beard of Zeus, 'tis Hercules!Â  The Lion of Olympus crashes the Crash Pad, and he's after Aegis!Â  Find out why in this series' frantic final issue!
name: Judgement Day

description: Taking the adventures of Kirby's brooding New God and member of the JLA in exciting new directions, ORION starts with a bang (or maybe a "BOOM!") as the title character seeks the truth about his being the son of Darkseid. In the incredible first issue, Orion confronts his mother, Tigra, about her claim that he is not truly Darkseid's child. Refusing to believe her words, he seeks the counsel of others, traveling to the heart of the Source and then to the darkness of Apokolips for answers. But the one who would know best, Darkseid, is nowhere to be found because, unbeknownst to Orion, he is wreaking havoc on Earth, taking over a city in the heartland of America as part of his voracious quest for the Anti- Life Equation!
name: O Beautiful for Spacious Skies...

description: The JLA's deadliest member confronts Darkseid! Darkseid's taken over an entire Midwestern town in hopes of discovering the Anti- Life Equation! This town is just like your hometown, except everyone is under the strict control of Apokolips. Come to think of it, that may be like your hometown, too!
name: ...For Amber Waves of Grain!

description: From the start, the ongoing ORION series has proven that writer/artist Walter Simonson has a keen mastery of the characters that populate the "Fourth World" created by comics legend Jack Kirby. But that's not to say that Simonson is the only person capable of handling those iconic figures and, beginning with ORION #3, the magnanimous Simonson begins sharing the spotlight in backup features written by him and others and illustrated by some of the rest of the best artists the comic-book field has to offer. And to start things off right, the backup story in ORION #3 is drawn by none other than Frank Miller (BATMAN: THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS, Sin City, 300)! The 6-page story tells the incredible, not-for-the-faint-of-heart story of Orion's fierce and horrifying birth, revealing details of Orion's mother Tigra's treachery against Darkseid and Darkseid's own, unforgettable revenge against mother and son alike. Future issues are planned that will feature other stories of Orion and his fellow New Gods, illustrated by an array of artists that includes Dave Gibbons, Howard Chaykin, Erik Larsen, and many more!
name: For Purple Mountain Majesties...

description: Darkseid and Orion must confront each other for a final time...but will it be as father and son? Secrets are revealed and tensions mount as we build to next issue's unforgettable battle between the most powerful of the New Gods. Plus, in a backup story illustrated by Dave Gibbons (WATCHMEN, TOM STRONG), the luminous Lightray must try to go unnoticed on a secretive journey to Apokolips.
name: Above the Fruited Plain...; Ashes, Ashes, We All Fall Down....

description: A full-length battle between Orion and Darkseid by writer/artist Walter Simonson! It's the battle of the New Gods readers have been demanding as father faces son in unrestrained combat! Only one of these warriors is going to walk away from an epic conflagration the likes of which you've never seen before!
name: Day of Wrath

description: In the aftermath of last issue's explosive battle, there's a new ruler in Apokolips, and he's inherited Darkseid's confidante, Mortalla, whose advice is a poor substitute for a Mother Box. But is the new leader Orion? Or is it Kalibak? Plus, a back-up tale written by Eric Stephenson with art by Erik Larsen and Al Gordon features DeSaad and Camelback. They talk the talk. Can they walk the walk?
name: The King is Dead... Long Live the King!; The Perfect Servant

description: It's Orion vs. a strength-increased Kalibak, in a battle to determine who rules Apokolips! But what secret does Desaad hold, and will it help or hurt Orion?
name: Tough Love!; Death and His Brother

description: Orion battles Desaad's army of clones of Billion Dollar Bates. On Earth, the Newsboy Legion pays off all the Suicide Slum tax liens, attracting the attention of crooked developer Arnicus Wolfram.
name: The Righteous Treacheries of Desaad! Or Orion Rules!; Dead End

description: Orion may have won his latest battle, but it's at a price for he has been altered somehow by the events of the previous issue. Now changed, he must face Desaad, who can no longer sit idly by and watch as Orion continues to rule Apokolips!
name: The Electro Death of Honor!

description: As Orion continues as ruler of Apokolips, one enemy remains, his father's most faithful henchman -- Desaad! Wanting to ascend to the throne himself, Desaad formulates his assassination plans. Meanwhile, why is Mother Box no longer responding to Orion? Plus, a backup feature written by Simonson and illustrated by Adams.
name: Sirius Business! Or Dog is God Spelled Backwards!; Light!

description: It's full-length action from Walter Simonson as Orion takes over New Genesis and adds its might to his, thanks to the Anti-Life Equation! But what sinister, shadowy forces are plotting to destroy Orion before it's too late? It may already be too late for Desaad... Orion kills him this issue!
name: Orion Rules!

description: Orion returns to Apokolips only to find that no living being on that benighted planet can say no to him! Justeen decides she must act now! And what of New Genesis while Orion rules its rival world?
name: Legends of Apokolips; The Ordering of Apokolips; The Garden

description: Guest-starring the JLA and Captain Marvel, in a special 2-part story written by Walt Simonson and illustrated by John Byrne and Terry Austin! Now that Orion possesses the Anti-Life Equation, the World's Greatest Heroes are concerned about Orion's seemingly limitless power. Will the new ruler of Apokolips bring the "benefits" of his rule to Earth? Plus, a backup tale written and illustrated by Simonson has the denizens of Apokolips arming themselves against New Genesis.
name: The Ordering of Earth!; The Arming of Apokolips!

description: Concluding the 2-part story guest-illustrated by John Byrne & Terry Austin, guest-starring the JLA and Captain Marvel! Orion travels to Earth while the New Gods are hot on his heels...to see Orion dead! Meanwhile, the armed troops of New Genesis thunder through the Himalayas to confront the most powerful man in the universe the man with the anti-life equation!
name: The Ordering of the Cosmos!; Frankenstein's Legacy

description: An extra-sized issue has Orion facing the return of Darkseid! Orion is exiled from the universe, taking the effects of the Anti-Life Equation with him. But he's been exiled from time and space as we know it...to encounter...what?
name: At the Edge of the Abyss; Greater Than/Lesser Than

description:
Overview

Frank Castle has gone back to basics. Back in New York, back from the dead and back doing what he does best: exterminating bad guys and waging his personal war on crime. The Punisher is here to clean up the mean streets of New York City, and the gutters are overflowing with drug dealers, mob scum and law-breaking skels. And just wait until you check out Frank's new bachelor pad - with his roommate Death! It's a gritty tale of bullet-ridden, gut-wrenching action as you like it!

First chapter of Welcome Back Frank. The Punisher kills a Gnucci gangster by flinging him off the top of the Empire State Building.
name: Welcome Back, Frank

description:
Wanna talk bad luck? Consider the sad case of Detective Martin Soap, a loser whose next assignment is to capture the Punisher! And his partner is even a bigger waste than he is! If that's not enough to pack it up and join a monastery, Detective Soap also has to deal with the ongoing war between Frank Castle and mob boss Ma Gnucci! Meanwhile, the Punisher chows down on a meal of C-4 charges, an out-of-control limo, a priest with an axe to grind and a human projectile... eat up, Frankie!

Second chapter of Welcome Back Frank. The Punisher continues his crusade against the Gnucci crime family.
name: Badaboom, Badabing

description:
The Punisher's war on low-life crime continues as he sets his eye, as well as his rifle scope, on mob boss Ma Gnucci's favorite son! Who could possibly come between one of the Punisher's targets and a bullet? Only Daredevil, the Man Without Fear!

Third part of Welcome Back Frank. The Punisher faces Daredevil at the docks.
name: The Devil by the Horns

description: We'd tell you that this issue contains some hidden deep meaning concerning mankind's role in the universe... but that would make us liars! So instead expect more dead Gnuccis and more spent bullet casings littering the pavement as the Punisher continues his merciless, no holds barred, war against scum.
name: Wild Kingdom

description: Frank Castle's one man war on the Gnucci clan continues to escalate?and if you think they have it bad, just imagine what will happen when a run-of-the-mill lowlife mugger comes face-to-face with the merchant of vigilante death! Let's just say it won't be pretty. Plus: Mr. Payback, Elite and a whole host of Punisher wannabes are crawling out of the woodwork to clean up the streets of NYC... that is, if you consider spilled blood a disinfectant!
name: Even Worse Things

description: It's bad news when Ma Gnucci and family finally track down the Punisher?but for whom? Meanwhile, the streets run red as those Frank Castle wannabes, Payback and the Elite, continue their respective murder sprees!
name: Spit Out of Luck

description: Has someone narked out the Punisher?! For months, Frank Castle has concealed his existence from his fellow tenants. But now, as Frank lies near death due to last issue's events, will his true identity be discovered? Plus: While the Elite continues his "neighborhood clean-up" project, Mr. Payback goes public!
name: Bring Out Your Dead

description:
Lying near death with the Gnuccis closing in, Frank Castle has certainly seen better days. But can the Punisher pick himself off the canvas in time to save his friend, Spacker Dave? And just when you thought you've seen Ma Gnucci throw everything she can at Frank, enter the Russian!

Eight part of Welcome Back Frank. First appearance of The Russian.
name: Desperate Measures

description: He's big, he's bad, he's Bolshevik! He's the Russian, and he's been brought in by Ma Gnucci to squash the Punisher once and for all! But he'd better hurry, because it's moving day for Frank Castle! The question is, how do his neighbors feel about this?
name: From Russia with Love

description: Wolverine, Bullseye, the Hulk. The Punisher has faced his share of tough guys, but will he be able to survive the killer known as the Russian?
name: Glutton for Punishment

description: Â Â
name: A Chilly Day in Opal

description: You've seen her in issue #0, you'll be seeing her in JSA #1, but here it is: the origin and first adventure of DC's newest Star! Freshly moved to Blue Valley (former home of Kid Flash!), Courtney Whitmore learns a secret about her new step-dad, Pat: he was once known as Stripesy, the Golden Age sidekick of the original Star-Spangled Kid! And what better way to irritate the new dad by forcing him to be a sidekick again... to her, as the new Star-Spangled Kid makes her action-packed debut at Blue Valley High?
name: New Kid on the Block

description: S.T.R.I.P.E. can only save the new Star Spangled Kid from the ultimate terror if he can get his suit to stop conking out while he's flying 300 feet in the air! And what is Courtney's ultimate terror? Why, detention, of course! Also: the new villain called Paintball explodes all over Blue Valley High!
name: True Colors

description: What sucks more than high school in Blue Valley? The human mosquito called Skeeter! When one of Dr. Graft's experiments goes astray, it's up to the new Star Spangled Kid and S.T.R.I.P.E. to stop the overgrown pest from putting the bite on Blue Valley's blood supply! Plus: a brief appearance by the mortal counterparts of the Marvel Family in a prelude to this summer's explosive crossover event!
name: Bloodrush!

description: The Marvel Family guest-stars to help our heroes confront the DAY OF JUDGMENT! Captain Marvel, Mary Marvel and CM3 must help the new Star Spangled Kid and S.T.R.I.P.E. as they face the threat of a revived Solomon Grundy in the heart of Blue Valley!
name: Waking the Dead!

description: Part 1 of a 2-part story guest-starring Young Justice! The new Star-Spangled Kid is going to need the junior heroes' help as they all get caught up in an alien take-over of Blue Valley! And the only thing worse than several members of YJ turning into aliens themselves is that the Kid's meeting Robin wearing her brand-new braces!
name: The Subs, Part One

description: Concluding a 2-part story guest-starring Young Justice! Impulse and the Star Spangled Kid have been turned into blue-skinned aliens, and it's only a matter of time before the rest of Young Justice follow suit! That is, unless, S.T.R.I.P.E. and the others can find a cure!
name: The Subs, Part Two

description: S.T.R.I.P.E. is deactivated on the field of battle at Blue Valley High, setting the stage for the stunning confrontation between Shiv and the Star Spangled Kid! And then...the mysterious Dragon King finally makes his move! Also: this issue features the first glimpse of S.T.R.I.P.E.'s son, the Kid's step-brother, Mike Dugan! Â
name: You Kids Today!

description: Here's something ya' don't see in super-hero comics every day, the Star-Spangled Kid cheats! And all it serves to do is get her noticed by Dr. Graft, Blue Valley's resident evil genius! Cheaters only cheat themselves, and sometimes they face the ultimate penalty (and we're not talking detention here)!
name: Crisis In Blue Valley

description: The Nebula Man returns, and the Shining Knight is not far behind, as the Star- Spangled Kid learns a hard lesson in the history of S.T.R.I.P.E. and the original Kid! See the Seven Soldiers of Victory fight their last battle as Pat (Stripesy) Dugan lays a little legacy at Courtney's feet! Also: Meet Mike Dugan, the Kid's step-brother!
name: The Final Hour for the 7 Soldiers of Victory

description: They say cheaters never prosper...unless prospering means having your brain transferred into on of Dr. Graft's monstrous experimental beings! Courtney learns this lesson the hard way! Also: Mom finds Courtney's Star-Spangled Kid uniform! Â
name: Shortcuts

description: The Shining Knight and the Star-Spangled Kid take some Graft, Dr. Graft that is, as the nefarious Dragon King makes his move! The King's daughter, Shiv, attacks S.T.R.I.P.E. and the Kid where they live, literally, as Pat's Pit Stop is besieged! Plus, Courtney and her step- brother, Mike, fight over the Star-Spangled Kid's Cosmic Converter Belt. Sibling rivalry is one thing, but this could be explosive! Â
name: Knight Time

description: The Dragon King's plan reaches a climactic moment as he takes the lives of all Blue Valley's students into his control...including the Star-Spangled Kid! It's all-out mayhem at ground zero (Courtney's house!) as Shiv and D.K. gain the upper hand! Â
name: Dragon Food!

description: The climactic battle with the Dragon King pits the Star-Spangled Kid against her step- father S.T.R.I.P.E. to save the youth of Blue Valley and the world! Also: Courtney's past comes a-knocking and there's news of another new arrival heading for the Dugan household! Â
name: The Defiant Ones

description: The tear-Spangled final issue! The Star-Spangled Kid is faced with the greatest villain of her young career...a villain called "Dad!" Plus, who is destined to be the new S.T.R.I.P.E.? Also where will the Kid's brand-new Star-Car take her as her series comes to an end? Â
name: Heirlooms

description:
The Legion's difficulties escalate when conflicts between the government and R.J. Brande intensify, problems arise related to the team's newest member, and trouble falls from the sky.

A new version of the Legion of Super-Heroes is introduced in this issue, after the events of Zero Hour. While the Legionnaires must mourn the loss of James Cullen, the first Legionnaire to fall in battle, XS learns that the Legion is where she wants to remain. Meanwhile, Mano destroys his planet and blames McCauley for its tragedy.
name: The Quick And The Dead

description:
Some Legionnaires have second thoughts about the team after being forced into an all-out battle on the moon to save the life of R.J. Brande's greatest rival.

The Legionnaires chase down Mano to the moon and are able to defeat him before he can kill Leland McCauley or destroy the moon. After their mission, they return to find that the planet of Winath has sent a representative to join the Legion to replace Live Wire: his sister, Ayla.

This story is continued in Legion of Super-Heroes (volume 4) #64
name: Mano a Mano!

description:
The Legion faces its greatest challenge yet when a rival team reveals itself, composed of an ultra-powered boy, a master of many ancient fighting arts, a wielder of tremendous heat, and a rampaging beast.

Live Wire joins the Workforce, a team created by Leland McCauley to compete with R.J. Brande's Legion of Super-Heroes, after he quits due to legality issues. Meanwhile, the Legionnaires answer a plea for help from a prison located in a sun. Things seem to be going well until they are attacked by a spacecraft, causing the power to die in the prison eventually, letting loose all the criminals.
name: Enter The Workforce!

description:
The Legion of Super-Heroes is captured and incarcerated on the prison planet as that world's freed inmates seek a cache of hidden weapons that will make them invincible.

The members of the Legion of Super-Heroes and of Workforce work together to save the lives of all the incarcerated criminals in the prison they are at.
name: Hard Time

description:
The Legionnaires face their greatest challenge: a Saturday night with nothing to do!

The Legion enjoy some free time and the lady members decide to go to a night club. Getting in proves to be an ordeal, though. Invisible Kid is able to create Legion rings for all the members that allow them to fly and communicate each other.
name: Flight

description:
The Legionnaires learn of the nightmare life Triad lived before joining the Legion, as they rush to save her when one of her three bodies is critically injured.

Brainiac 5 tries to save the life of Triad after a brutal, racist assault against her. Her history and origin is revealed and Brainiac 5 is able to save her life.
name: Me, Myself And I

description:
Chameleon comes fist-to-fist with a revenge-seeking native of his home planet, who just happens to have all the powers of the Legion members combined.

The Legion of Super-Heroes face the might of the Composite Man.
name: Skin Deep

description:
Apparition and Ultra Boy try to sort out their feelings for each other, but their membership in rival super-teams may doom their romance before it begins.

Apparition joins Ultra Boy when he must answer a call with Workforce. Meanwhile, someone from Titan arrives to help Saturn Girl out of her coma.
name: Authority

description:
As the United Planets demand the resignations of three Legionnaires, Legion mentor R.J. Brande's network of Stargates comes under attack by the Daxamites.

The White Triangle, a racist hate group, attacks couples where each member is from a different planet. When they decide to attack Apparition and Ultra Boy, they get in a fight and lose. Meanwhile, Roxxas, a representative from Daxam, uses his power to get Andromeda off the team even though Cosmic Boy was petitioning for the same thing since she is a member of the White Triangle.
name: Eyes Of Hate!

description:
An army of super-powered Daxamites is ravaging the galaxy, leaving a trail of death and destruction that leads to Earth.

The Legion of Super-Heroes continue to deal with the threat of the White Triangle, who are being led by Roxxas and some super-powered Daxamites.
name: Nightfall

description:
Overview

Part 2 of "Return to Krypton!" Superman's visit and reunion with his father Jor-El may be cut short as his father's enemy, General Zod, unleashes the Eradicators against them.
name: Jor-El vs. Atomic City! : Return to Krypton Part 2 : Second Honeymoon

description:
Barry Allen travels to Coast City for the first time to spend a weekend with his new JLA teammate Hal Jordan. But rest and relaxation will have to wait as an alien threat emerges!

Forensic scientist Barry Allen and test pilot Hal Jordan - aka the Fastest Man Alive and the Green Lantern of Earth - decide to spend a guy's weekend together, as pals. Unfortunately, mysterious and murderous shadows have other plans!

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold

description:
Green Lantern brings his new girlfriend, Olivia Reynolds, to Central City to meet Barry, Iris, and Wally. But Hal doesn't realize he's been followed by Black Hand.

Hal's taking a trip to Central City this time, and he's finally getting to meet Barry's nephew, Wally West - otherwise known as Kid Flash. But when Black Hand saps Wally's super-speed, then Hal decides to deputise the boy: exit Kid Flash, enter Kid Lantern!
name: Lightspeed

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold

description:
When two Flashes--Barry Allen and Jay Garrick--and two Green Lanterns--Hal Jordan and Alan Scott--take a vacation together, what could possibly go wrong?

Barry and Hal are on holiday yet again, but this time there's two differences: one, they've invited their predecessors Alan Scott and Jay Garrick and two, they're not taking it on Earth!
name: A World of Hurt

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold

description:
Socially conscious heroes Hal Jordan and Oliver Queen hit the streets of Central City to investigate allegations of a police department gone Gestapo. But what's police scientist Barry Allen's take on this "problem"?

Deuteronomy Phist, Central City's new Mayor, is doing a good job against crime... a little too good, according to Green Arrow. He intends to take back the streets, with or without The Flash's say-so!
name: How Many Times Can a Man Turn His Head?

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold

description:
A cosmic plague is spreading across the galaxy, and in order to combat it, the Guardians of the Universe call in their most trusted Green Lantern: Barry Allen?

The universe is threatened by a mysterious and deadly force that can destroy even Green Lanterns, so the Guardians of the Universe call on... Barry Allen?

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold

description:
While free-wheeling Green Lantern Hal Jordan entertains an offer to return to his job as a test pilot for Carol Ferris, the life of usually rock-steady Flash Barry Allen is in complete chaos following the death of his wife, Iris Allen.

Iris Allen is dead. Hal Jordan tires to get Barry to snap out of the terrible depression he's fallen into, but they're interrupted by Star Sapphire and... Star Sapphire?
name: Running on Empty

volume.name: Flash & Green Lantern: The Brave and the Bold
